Louis Parnormo Parlour Guitar 1843 - Natural

extended_attributes.title: Louis Parnormo Parlour Guitar 1843 - Natural
extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
THE LONDON PARLOUR GUITAR

History 

Louis Panormo (1784 – 1862) was a prominent English luthier of the 19th century, best known for his classical guitars, which were among the earliest made in England to follow the Spanish design. Often referred to as the "only English guitar maker of the time to make guitars in the Spanish style,"Panormo played a significant role in popularizing Spanish-style guitars in Britain during the early Romantic era

Louis Panormo Parlour 

1843 

Spruce Top 

Rosewood Back & Sides 

Internally/Externally Original 

Original Coffin Case 

Condition 8.75+/10 

Sound / Playability - Guitar has exceptional tone and feel

Comments 

The above instrument produced was produced by Britain’s Most Prominent English Luthier and nearing 200 years old it is exceptional condition both cosmetically and sonically.

ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID

1957

Serial  Number - 21317

Sunburst

Maple Neck

Internally / Externally Original

Condition 7/10 (Normal Playing Wear)

Original Case

Sound/Tone 

Optimum sounding 50s Stratocaster 

Comments 

The above is an original 1957 Stratocaster sourced from its original family ownership that will be of interest from  both players and collectors who require a highly documented instrument that is the optimum in tone and feel

extended_attributes.description: THE HENDRIX CONNECTIONThe following instrument, in collector and investor terms, is one of the rarest of all post-CBS Stratocasters, carrying similar specification to Jimi Hendrix's most favoured Stratocaster that he used on many notable performances, including the Royal Albert Hall , Madison Square Gardens and the Atlanta Pop Festival. Details are:1969 Fender Stratocaster Black Slab Maple Neck (exceptionally rare) White Guard Internally / Externally Original (except refret) Condition 8/10 Original Case Original Swing Tags, Merchandise , CataloguesSound The instrument is the optimum in sound, tone, feel Comments The above instrument based on colour and neck combination (Slab Maple) was produced in exceptionally small and limited numbers, making it the rarest and to many the most desired of all post-CBS Stratocasters

extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
We are happy to offer the following items from the personal private collection of iconic keyboardist and synth collector Rick Wakeman. Rick career has spanned over 50 years including his time with The Strawbs and YES through to his session work with David Bowie, Black Sabbath and countless others. Alongside this, Rick's own solo career has pushed the boundaries of possibilities in terms of his use of the synthesiser including his albums Journey to the Centre of the Earth and the Six wives of Henry VIII.

Rick is now pleased to be offering his fans the chance to owns some of the pieces which have sculpted his sound across his extensive career. Please find details of these pieces as below:

Polivoks MiniMoog

1980s
Russian Production
Gifted to Rick by a Fan.
Very Rare model based on a a MiniMoog

Each item will come with written verification direct from Rick Wakeman to confirm his ownership and use of the items.

Pricing

All items have been in storage many since the 1970s and will require servicing by the purchaser. This costing is reflected in the pricing of each item.

ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID 

All purchases include EU Taxes / Duties paid , ie nothing further is due on receipt of goods to any EU State  

WHY BUY FROM US  

We are one of the world's leading specialists in used and vintage gear with over 30 years of experience. Prior to shipping each item will be fully serviced and professionally packed 

SELL - TRADE - CONSIGN  

If you are looking to sell, trade or consign any of your classic gear please contact us by message.

WORLDWIDE COLLECTION - DELIVERY  

We offer personal delivery and collection services worldwide with offices/locations in London, Amsterdam and Chicago.

VALUATION SERVICE  

If you require a valuation of any of your classic year please forward a brief description and pictures and we will come back to your ASAP.

extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
*** ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID ***

NEW LIMITED EDITON

HISTORY: The Rangemaster Fuzzbug was released in late 1966 as a competitor to the already popular range of Tone Bender Pedals. Only a small handful of these original prototype pedals were produced and to many Fuzzaholics is the Holy Grail Of Fuzz. The Original Rangemaster Fuzz Bug took its lead from the Original Tone Bender Design featuring a cast aluminium casing and two circuit variants, The MKI.5 Two Transistor Circuit and the MKII Three Transistor circuit.

The British Pedal Company are pleased to breath new life into this rare fuzz giving users/players the to opportunity to add these cool fuzzes to their collection each of which are signed and numbered from 1- 25.

Specification:

1966 Reissue
Aluminium Cast Casing
Silver Hammer Finish
Hand Applied Graphics
2x OC75 Transistors
Volume & Sustain Controls
9V Battery
Handbuilt in the UK
Signed by Builder
Numbered Certificate

Limited Edition of 25 Worldwide

extended_attributes.description: *** ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID ***BPC MKI Tone BenderThe BPC MKI Tone Bender is a detailed replica of the original 1965 Metal Case Tone Bender pedal created by Gary Hurst in London, England. The BPC MKI features the same transistor specification as the original so includes 1x OC75 + 2x 2G381 this configuaration has a unique tone which cannot be replicated by the often offered 3xOC75 version. It was this version which found its way into the hands of artists such as Jeff Beck, Pete Townsend and Mick Ronson and can be heard on many classic tracks such as ‘Hang onto yourself’ and ‘Moonage Daydream’.BPC MKI Tone Bender Folded metal casing Level and Attack controls 1x OC75 + 2x 2G381 Limited production As used by Jeff Beck, Mick Ronson and Pete Townshend Certificate of authenticity WHY BUY FROM US? extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
*** ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID ***

BPC MKI Tone Bender

The BPC MKI Tone Bender is a detailed replica of the original 1965 Metal Case  Tone Bender pedal created by Gary Hurst in London, England. The BPC MKI features the same transistor specification as the original so includes  1x OC75 + 2x 2G381 this configuaration has a unique tone which cannot be replicated by the often offered 3xOC75 version. It was this version which found its way into the hands of artists such as Jeff Beck, Pete Townsend and Mick Ronson and can be heard on many classic tracks such as ‘Hang onto yourself’ and ‘Moonage Daydream’.

BPC MKI Tone Bender

  • Folded metal casing
  • Level and Attack controls
  • 1x OC75 + 2x 2G381
  • Limited production
  • As used by Jeff Beck, Mick Ronson and Pete Townshend
  • Certificate of authenticity


WHY BUY FROM US? We are one of the world's leading specialists in used and vintage gear with over 30 years of experience. Prior to shipping each item will be fully tested and checked so it arrives ready to use and enjoy. If you have any questions we are happy to assist 24/7.

1954 Fender Stratocaster

August 1954

This instrument was personally owned and used By Eric Johnson, who specifically  prefers '54 Fender Stratocasters  because of their unique tone and feel. extended_attributes.description: Based on the benchmark sounds of the MXR M117 Flanger, the MXR Micro Flanger features many of the same flanging effects of its big brother, but in a smaller and more convenient size. Originally released in the '80s, this faithful recreation features the same two critical controls—a Speed knob to control the rate of cycling and a Regeneration knob to manage the overall intensity—and stays true to its 100% analog bucket brigade technology for the ultimate in warm and organic tone. The Micro Flanger has been updated with a true bypass switch so you don't lose any tone during bypass. Go from jet plane like sweeps to cool outer space type effects with the MXR Micro Flanger.Condition 8/10 Minor Board useALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID All purchases include EU Taxes / Duties paid , ie nothing further is due on receipt of goods to any EU State WHY BUY FROM US We are one of the world's leading specialists in used and vintage gear with over 30 years of experience. extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
Based on the benchmark sounds of the MXR M117 Flanger, the MXR Micro Flanger features many of the same flanging effects of its big brother, but in a smaller and more convenient size. Originally released in the '80s, this faithful recreation features the same two critical controls—a Speed knob to control the rate of cycling and a Regeneration knob to manage the overall intensity—and stays true to its 100% analog bucket brigade technology for the ultimate in warm and organic tone. The Micro Flanger has been updated with a true bypass switch so you don't lose any tone during bypass. Go from jet plane like sweeps to cool outer space type effects with the MXR Micro Flanger.

Condition 8/10 Minor Board use

extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
THE SOUND OF THE SMITHS

We are happy to offer the following Gretsch Country Gentleman that was owned and used by the Godfather of the Manchester Movement that being Johnny Marr of the Smiths, details as follows:

Gretsch Country Gentleman

Walnut 

Twin Pickups 

Bigsby Vibrato 

Original Road / Touring Case 

Condition - Stage , Tour Used 

Favoured Tone 

Original Gretsch Country Gentleman's have been used and favoured my many respected and influential artists from George Harrison of The Beatles  though to his fellow Mancunian John Squire off The Stone Roses 

History 

The above instrument was custom Made for Johnny Marr and was used for live and recording purposes  that included  “Satelite Skin “ for modest mouse 

Verification 

The guitar comes with the following verification 

Personal letter from Johnny Marr to confirm, use ownership

Various Online and Published Archival Pictures 

History Of Use 

The above instrument was used for both stage , touring and recording purposes and was a Key Ingredient to Johnny Mars Guitar Sound 

Comments 

Johnny Marr to many is the Godfather of the Madchester Movement with his guitar style and tone instantly recognisable. 

HISTORY OF PRODUCTION

The first series Gold Block Logo JTM45s were produced in exceptionally small numbers and are highly sought after by both players and collectors due to their rarity and exceptional tonal qualities.

SOUND/TONE

Due to their high-grade component quality, values, and circuit design, these early Marshall 45s have tonal characteristics similar to a Fender Tweed amplifier but with more gain/drive, synonymous with classic Marshall British tone. In collector/player terms, this is the ultimate JTM45.

Comments

One of the world’s most desired vintage amplifiers, both in tone and rarity. Favored by many iconic British artists, including Eric Clapton and Pete Townshend.

DBX 155 Dual rack unit

  • Type: Noise reduction processor
  • Channels: Dual-channel operation
  • Noise Reduction Type: dbx® Type I noise reduction

Performance:

  • Dynamic Range: Greater than 100 dB
  • Frequency Response: 20 Hz to 20 kHz
  • Total Harmonic Distortion (THD): < 0.05%

extended_attributes.description: THE GALAXY OF STRATSThe following instrument is one of the most published and historically important Fender Stratocaster's to have been released for public sale. Originally custom built by the Fender Factory in 1955 for legendary 'Thumbs’ Carllile in its Non-Standard Flamingo Pink it features twin pickups and almost 2 inch neck width, details as follows Fender Stratocaster 1955 Neck Date 12 - 55 Ash Bodied Natural Finish (Originally Fiesta Red as seen in cavities although later Stripped to Natural) Twin Pickup Silver Aluminium Guard and rear tremolo plate Unique, Custom Order Weight Original Case Published Media The guitar has been featured in various Published Media that includes as follows The Galaxy of Strats The Tom Wheeler 50 Years of the Fender Stratocaster Verification The guitar comes with the following verification Personal Letter John English Fenders Master Builder confirming its originality Personal Letter from Larry Briggs Strings West Outlining the guitars history Comments The above is one of the worlds most historically important Fender Stratocasters to have been released for public sale and will be of interest to many collectors and investors whom require one of fenders most historically important instruments ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAIDAll purchases include EU Taxes / Duties paid , ie nothing further is due on receipt of goods to any EU State.WHY BUY FROM US We are one of the world's leading specialists in used and vintage gear with over 30 years of experience. extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
THE GALAXY OF STRATS

The following instrument is one of the most published and historically important Fender Stratocaster's to have been released for public sale. Originally custom built by the Fender Factory in 1955 for legendary 'Thumbs’ Carllile in its Non-Standard Flamingo Pink it features twin pickups and almost 2 inch neck width, details as follows 

Fender Stratocaster 

1955 

Neck Date 12 - 55 

Ash Bodied 

Natural Finish  (Originally Fiesta Red as seen in cavities although later Stripped to Natural) 

Twin Pickup 

Silver Aluminium Guard and rear tremolo plate 

Unique, Custom Order 

Weight 

Original Case 

Published Media 

The guitar has been featured in various Published Media that includes as follows 

The Galaxy of Strats 

The Tom Wheeler 50 Years of the Fender Stratocaster 

Verification 

The guitar comes with the following verification 

Personal Letter John English Fenders Master Builder confirming its originality 

Personal Letter from Larry Briggs Strings West Outlining the guitars history 

Comments 

The above is one of the worlds most historically important Fender Stratocasters to have been released for public sale and will be of  interest to many collectors and  investors whom require one of fenders most historically important instruments

The British Pedal Company were priviledged to recieve exclusive access from the Gallagher family to Rory’s original No.1 Rangemaster. This along with his 1961 Fender Stratocaster was the key component in Rory’s iconic tone which definied the history of Irish blues music. This unit has been authorized by the Gallagher family and built to the specification of Rory’s original Number 1 Rangemaster.

extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
SRV

Stephen Ray Vaughan (October 3, 1954 – August 27, 1990) was an American musician, best known as the guitarist and frontman of the blues rock trio Stevie Ray Vaughan and Double Trouble. Although his mainstream career spanned only seven years, he is regarded as one of the most influential musicians in the history of blues music, and one of the greatest guitarists of all time.


THE 1965 SRV STRATOCASTER 

The following has direct links and connections to the great Stevie Ray Vaughan who played and used the instrument for 163 occasions between 1976 - 1978  

Fender Stratocaster 

1965

Sunburst 

Rosewood Neck 

Tremolo 

White  Guard 

Condition 8/10 (Used/Played) 

Orignal Strap 

Original Road/Touring Case  

Note 

The  instrument carries same specification as several of Stevie Ray Vaughan's most Famous  and iconic vintage Stratocasters 

Verification  - Package 

The instrument comes with the following 

Personalised and officially Notarised COA detailing the history of the above instrument 

Various Pictures of Use 

The above will be of interest to both players, collectors and investors whom have interest an original 1960s Fender Stratocaster that was heavily played and used by the great Stevie Ray Vaughan

The Ramirez 1NE uses the classic combination of a solid cedar top with Indian rosewood back and sides, with an ebony fingerboard and gloss finish. This gives a very rich and warm tone overall, with nice clarity in the high end. Jose Ramirez, the most famous name in Spanish guitars, his instruments have been performed on by countless professionals from Sting to Segovia, Chet Atkins to Sabicas and Lee Ritenour to Christopher Parkening. The Ramirez 1NE uses the classic combination of a solid cedar top with Indian rosewood back and sides, with an ebony fingerboard and gloss finish. This gives a very rich and warm tone overall, with nice clarity in the high end. 

  • Prototype model of the Ramirez 1NE
  • E" models have slightly larger bodies and possess a deeper, darker tone than the smaller bodied "R" models.
  • Solid red cedar top,

extended_attributes.description: We are happy to offer the following items from the personal private collection of iconic keyboardist and synth collector Rick Wakeman. Rick career has spanned over 50 years including his time with The Strawbs and YES through to his session work with David Bowie, Black Sabbath and countless others. Alongside this, Rick's own solo career has pushed the boundaries of possibilities in terms of his use of the synthesiser including his albums Journey to the Centre of the Earth and the Six wives of Henry VIII.Rick is now pleased to be offering his fans the chance to owns some of the pieces which have sculpted his sound across his extensive career. extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
We are happy to offer the following items from the personal private collection of iconic keyboardist and synth collector Rick Wakeman. Rick career has spanned over 50 years including his time with The Strawbs and YES through to his session work with David Bowie, Black Sabbath and countless others. Alongside this, Rick's own solo career has pushed the boundaries of possibilities in terms of his use of the synthesiser including his albums Journey to the Centre of the Earth and the Six wives of Henry VIII.

Rick is now pleased to be offering his fans the chance to owns some of the pieces which have sculpted his sound across his extensive career. Please find details of these pieces as below:

Sequential Circuits Prophet Remote

1970s
External Remote for Prophet 5
Pitch Bending and LFO Wheels

Each item will come with written verification direct from Rick Wakeman to confirm his ownership and use of the items.

Pricing

All items have been in storage many since the 1970s and will require servicing by the purchaser. This costing is reflected in the pricing of each item.

ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID 

All purchases include EU Taxes / Duties paid , ie nothing further is due on receipt of goods to any EU State  

WHY BUY FROM US

extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
THE RIC RAC STUDIOS COLLECTION

We are pleased to offer the following item which was purchased directly from RIC RAC Studios who were responsible for shaping the sound of countless artists including THE SISTERS OF MERCY and Shed Seven

Please see details as follows


Analogue echo based on the bucket brigade device principle (BBD, bucket memory), so it can echo indefinitely

Vintage, early 1980s
Unlimited setting, from a short, clean reverb to an endlessly long, granular feedback (lo-fi, grunge). The sound cannot be imitated digitally, so these analogue effects are so highly sought after.
Intuitive operation because of the stepless dials, the jack inputs and dB switches on the front side
Also nice to loop it to itself (for example via send channel of the mixing console), and then self-oscillates, or to go over the peak level with your input signal
For guitar, synth, drum computer, vocals or other instruments and (studio) equipment
220V

One control damaged

Please note although when removed from the studio the item was functioning, it may require additional service and is sold on an as seen basis

extended_attributes.description: THE JOHN LENNON PLASTIC ONO BANDWe are happy to offer the following that has direct links to one of the most iconic and influential of all artists that being John Lennon and was one and used during his time as a member of the Plastic Ono Elephants memory band , Details as follows Fender Bandmaster 1966 ( Circa ) Black Tolex Silver Grill 2+12 Plastic Ono Stencil Top / Rear Condition - Tour / Stage Used Sound Fender amp and speakers enclosures were favoured by John Lennon during later years of the Beatles and during his time in the Plastic Ono Band for both live and recording purposes Verification The speaker cabinet was purchased from an estate sale within the California Area along with the Bands Fender Dual Showman and an RMI Electric Piano All of which carrying the same band stencils ( Original Advertising , Listing is included with Purchase ) History Fender amplifiers were used by John Lennon for both live , studio and touring performances with Fenders being seen on stage during the 1972 Plastic Ono , Elephants Memory “ Live in New York City : Performance which was Lennons only rehearsed and full length live performance in his solo career and his first and last , formal full fledged live concerts since the Beatles retired from the Road in 1966 Comments This is a classic Fender Speaker cabinet that has direct links to one of the worlds most respected and iconic musicians that being John Lennon ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAIDAll purchases include EU Taxes / Duties paid , ie nothing further is due on receipt of goods to any EU State.WHY BUY FROM US We are one of the world's leading specialists in used and vintage gear with over 30 years of experience. extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
THE JOHN LENNON PLASTIC ONO BAND

We are happy to offer the following that has direct links to one of the most iconic and influential of all artists that being John Lennon and was one and used during his time as a member of the Plastic Ono Elephants memory band , Details as follows 

Fender Bandmaster 

1966 ( Circa ) 

Black Tolex 

Silver Grill 

2+12 

Plastic Ono Stencil Top / Rear 

Condition - Tour / Stage Used 

Sound 

Fender amp and speakers enclosures were favoured by John Lennon during later years of the Beatles and during his time in the Plastic Ono Band for both live and recording purposes 

Verification 

The speaker cabinet was purchased from an estate sale within the California Area along with the Bands Fender Dual Showman and  an RMI Electric Piano 

All of which carrying the same band stencils ( Original Advertising , Listing is included with Purchase ) 

History 

Fender amplifiers were used by John Lennon for both live , studio and touring performances with Fenders  being seen on stage during the 1972 Plastic Ono , Elephants Memory “ Live in New York City : Performance which was Lennons only rehearsed and full length live performance in his solo career and his first and last , formal full fledged live concerts since the Beatles retired from the Road in 1966 

Comments 

This is a classic Fender Speaker cabinet that has direct links to one of the worlds most respected and iconic musicians that being John Lennon

title: ART Tube PAC Tube Preamplifier / Compressor

extended_attributes.title: ART Tube PAC Tube Preamplifier / Compressor

nodes.title: Default Title
nodes.displayName: ART Tube PAC Tube Preamplifier / Compressor - Default Title

extended_attributes.description: THE RIC RAC STUDIOS COLLECTIONWe are pleased to offer the following item which was purchased directly from RIC RAC Studios who were responsible for shaping the sound of countless artists including THE SISTERS OF MERCY and Shed SevenPlease see details as followsART Tube PAC: This is a half-rack-width unit, and it operates at both line level and instrument level, balanced and unbalanced. "PAC" stands for "preamp and compressor". Essentially it is an upgraded version of their old Levelar model that I reviewed previously. It has lower noise, the tone is not as dark/muddy, and there is none of the click sound on the attack that I occasionally heard with the Levelar. There is very little noise, although the highs are "open" enough that any buzz/noise from your signal chain can get amplified noticeably. There is no loss of lows either. Note that during heavy compression the highs can get ducked down, so how the highs sound will depend on how you set and use the unit. The tone overall is warm and smooth, but not an exaggerated tubey effect. Some people have reported good results swapping in different tubes, for either cleaner or fatter sound. The only attack/release control is a button to switch between "auto" and "fast"; The auto setting works pretty decently, but I found myself using the "fast" mode more often. The ratio control is also limited to a button that switches between "compress" (~2:1) and "limit" (~6:1). The compress mode is better for tonal fattening, and the limit mode is better for a more effect-y dip-and-swell squash action. It's not actually a great peak limiter for slappers; real limiting requires a much higher ratio. The threshold knob and the LED metering are very useful features--using them (along with your ears of course) is the key to getting the best results. The top row of LEDs indicates how strongly your signal is driving the unit, and the bottom row indicates the amount of compression being applied. Because the PAC is also a mic preamp, it has some mic-related controls. There's a +20dB switch for boosting mics that have super low output; this could also be used to overdrive the input with your instrument, but doing that doesn't sound so good to me. There's a phantom power switch, and a switch for phase reversal. Most guitar/bassists wouldn't need those, but one exception would be an upright bassist who uses both a pickup and a mic at the same time.Please note although when removed from the studio the item was functioning, it may require additional service and is sold on an as seen basisALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID All purchases include EU Taxes / Duties paid, ie nothing further is due on receipt of goods to any EU State.WHY BUY FROM US We are one of the world's leading specialists in used and vintage gear with over 30 years of experience. Prior to shipping each item will be fully serviced and professionally packed.SELL - TRADE - CONSIGN If you are looking to sell, trade or consign any of your classic gear, please contact us by message.WORLDWIDE COLLECTION - DELIVERY We offer personal delivery and collection services worldwide with offices/locations in London, Amsterdam, and Chicago.VALUATION SERVICE If you require a valuation of any of your classic gear, please forward a brief description and pictures, and we will come back to you ASAP.
extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
THE RIC RAC STUDIOS COLLECTION

We are pleased to offer the following item which was purchased directly from RIC RAC Studios who were responsible for shaping the sound of countless artists including THE SISTERS OF MERCY and Shed Seven

Please see details as follows


ART Tube PAC: This is a half-rack-width unit, and it operates at both line level and instrument level, balanced and unbalanced. "PAC" stands for "preamp and compressor". Essentially it is an upgraded version of their old Levelar model that I reviewed previously. It has lower noise, the tone is not as dark/muddy, and there is none of the click sound on the attack that I occasionally heard with the Levelar.
 
There is very little noise, although the highs are "open" enough that any buzz/noise from your signal chain can get amplified noticeably. There is no loss of lows either. Note that during heavy compression the highs can get ducked down, so how the highs sound will depend on how you set and use the unit. The tone overall is warm and smooth, but not an exaggerated tubey effect. Some people have reported good results swapping in different tubes, for either cleaner or fatter sound.
 
The only attack/release control is a button to switch between "auto" and "fast"; The auto setting works pretty decently, but I found myself using the "fast" mode more often. The ratio control is also limited to a button that switches between "compress" (~2:1) and "limit" (~6:1). The compress mode is better for tonal fattening, and the limit mode is better for a more effect-y dip-and-swell squash action. It's not actually a great peak limiter for slappers; real limiting requires a much higher ratio. The threshold knob and the LED metering are very useful features--using them (along with your ears of course) is the key to getting the best results. The top row of LEDs indicates how strongly your signal is driving the unit, and the bottom row indicates the amount of compression being applied.
 
Because the PAC is also a mic preamp, it has some mic-related controls. There's a +20dB switch for boosting mics that have super low output; this could also be used to overdrive the input with your instrument, but doing that doesn't sound so good to me. There's a phantom power switch, and a switch for phase reversal. Most guitar/bassists wouldn't need those, but one exception would be an upright bassist who uses both a pickup and a mic at the same time.

Please note although when removed from the studio the item was functioning, it may require additional service and is sold on an as seen basis

extended_attributes.description: STUDIO SALEWe are pleased to offer the following item for saleMULTICOM PRO-XL MDX4600 V2The reference-class MDX4600 is a marvelous 4-channel Expander/Gate/Compressor/Peak Limiter that is ideal for: compressing mono/stereo signals and providing virtually inaudible noise suppression, without loss of high frequencies; increasing vocal presence and energy; and limiting, or smoothing out extremely-high signal peaks. Additionally, the MDX4600 features an integrated Dynamic Enhancer and Low-Contour filter to provide the ultimate in signal enrichment. Put simply, the MDX4600 can do amazing things for your vocals or instruments – providing virtually everything you need for studio-quality dynamics processing!Audio Dynamics ToolkitHere are just a few of the MDX4600�s outstanding capabilities: Switchable IKA (Interactive Knee Adaptation) � provides program-adaptive compression, combining all the advantages of both hard and soft-knee compression IRC (Interactive Ratio Control) Expander/Gate � ideal solution for noise floor reduction vs. applying notch filters and various equalizers for virtually inaudible noise suppression Enhancer � lets you emphasize the Bass, Midrange and Hi output at selectable frequencies for maximum punch, clarity and detail � without raising overall volume IGC (Interactive Gain Control) Peak Limiter � combines clipper and program limiter for reliable, inaudible protection against signal peaks Stereo Couple � links 1/2 and 3/4 channels, allowing dials and switches of Channels 1 and 3 to provide dynamics control over Channels 2 and 4, respectively (true stereo processing) Condition: 7/10ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAIDAll purchases include EU Taxes / Duties paid, ie nothing further is due on receipt of goods to any EU State.WHY BUY FROM USWe are one of the world's leading specialists in used and vintage gear with over 30 years of experience. extended_attributes.productType: Pro Audio / Outboard Gear / Gates and Expanders
extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
STUDIO SALE

We are pleased to offer the following item for sale

MULTICOM PRO-XL MDX4600 V2

The reference-class MDX4600 is a marvelous 4-channel Expander/Gate/Compressor/Peak Limiter that is ideal for: compressing mono/stereo signals and providing virtually inaudible noise suppression, without loss of high frequencies; increasing vocal presence and energy; and limiting, or smoothing out extremely-high signal peaks. Additionally, the MDX4600 features an integrated Dynamic Enhancer and Low-Contour filter to provide the ultimate in signal enrichment. Put simply, the MDX4600 can do amazing things for your vocals or instruments – providing virtually everything you need for studio-quality dynamics processing!

Audio Dynamics Toolkit

Here are just a few of the MDX4600�s outstanding capabilities:

  • Switchable IKA (Interactive Knee Adaptation) � provides program-adaptive compression, combining all the advantages of both hard and soft-knee compression 
  • IRC (Interactive Ratio Control) Expander/Gate � ideal solution for noise floor reduction vs. applying notch filters and various equalizers for virtually inaudible noise suppression
  • Enhancer � lets you emphasize the Bass, Midrange and Hi output at selectable frequencies for maximum punch, clarity and detail � without raising overall volume
  • IGC (Interactive Gain Control) Peak Limiter � combines clipper and program limiter for reliable, inaudible protection against signal peaks
  • Stereo Couple � links 1/2 and 3/4 channels, allowing dials and switches of Channels 1 and 3 to provide dynamics control over Channels 2 and 4, respectively (true stereo processing)

Condition: 7/10

In dual-band mode it splits the incoming signal between the two sections, processing each separately before recombining them. The result is a true dual-band compressor with individual controls for each bandThe Afterburner is a VCA compressor with Threshold and Output controls and Ratio continuously variable from 1:1 to ∞:1. extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
RIC RAC STUDIO COLLECTION 


We are happy to offer the following  collection from the late Bruce Haden’s  RIC RAC Studios which was  instrumental in defining the sounds of many respected musicians and  bands such as Sisters of Mercy , Shed Severn and many more , details as follows 

ARX AFTERBURNER

The ARX Afterburner is an unusual two-channel compressor which can be used as two mono, one stereo or a single-channel, dual-band compressor. In dual-band mode it splits the incoming signal between the two sections, processing each separately before recombining them. The result is a true dual-band compressor with individual controls for each band
The Afterburner is a VCA compressor with Threshold and Output controls and Ratio continuously variable from 1:1 to ∞:1. It has an Enhance button to “restore spectral balance of compressed signal”. There are in / out switches per-channel plus a stereo link switch and a master Dual Channel / Low-High Mode switch. Output Level and Gain Reduction are shown on LED meters and there’s a sidechain insert jack on the back panel

Condition 7/10

We are happy to offer the following items from the personal private collection of iconic keyboardist and synth collector Rick Wakeman. Rick career has spanned over 50 years including his time with The Strawbs and YES through to his session work with David Bowie, Black Sabbath and countless others. Alongside this, Rick's own solo career has pushed the boundaries of possibilities in terms of his use of the synthesiser including his albums Journey to the Centre of the Earth and the Six wives of Henry VIII.

Rick is now pleased to be offering his fans the chance to owns some of the pieces which have sculpted his sound across his extensive career. Please find details of these pieces as below:

Tone Wheel Organ
Double Manual
Purchased from Chingford Organ Studios

extended_attributes.description: THE BIRTH OF THE CLASHWe are happy to offer the following instrument from one of the most respected guitarists of the Post Punk Movement that being the late Keith Levene, founding member of the Clash. Hailed as an innovative guitarist who helped shape the sound of punk, Levene cowrote the song “What’s My Name” from The Clash’s 1977 debut album. Please see details as follows History Please see link for full history and credits of Artist Joe Strummer, Mick Jones, Terry Chimes, Paul Simenon and Keith Levine became The Clash in late 1976. Inspired by seeing The Sex Pistols and the music they were making, the boys quickly evolved a stance and image that endeared them to the punk masses. Their first outing was a gig at their rehearsal studios in Camden for journalists and friends which caused Giovanni Dadomo a reviewer for Sounds to opine "I think they're the first band to come along who'll really frighten the Sex Pistols shitless." Indeed their first public gig was supporting The Sex Pistols at The Screen On The Green Islington London. Charles Shaar Murray, in a famous quote he wishes he'd never made, said in the NME they "..are the kind of garage band who should speedily be returned to their garage, preferably with the motor running." This was too much for Levine who left leaving the boys as a four piece.Fernandes E series 1990s Grey Burst Flamed topHumbucker Hot Rail in NeckFernandez Floyd Rose Style TremoloCondition - Stage , Tour Used Signed verification confirming ownership and use by the artistThe Levene Style According to John Frusciante of the Red Hot Chili Peppers, Levene's style was “spectacular , .explored the possibilities of what you can do with the guitar".Upon his death, Massive Attack described Levene as an "artist, architect and re-inventor of punk rock”.Comments The above instrument will be to those players , collectors and investors whom have interest in an instrument that was personally owned and used by this highly respected Post Punk Guitarist and founding member of both the Clash and PiL.ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID All purchases include EU Taxes / Duties paid , ie nothing further is due on receipt of goods to any EU State WHY BUY FROM US We are one of the world's leading specialists in used and vintage gear with over 30 years of experience. extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
THE BIRTH OF THE CLASH

We are happy to offer the following instrument from one of the most respected guitarists of the Post Punk Movement that being the late Keith Levene, founding member of the Clash. Hailed as an innovative guitarist who helped shape the sound of punk, Levene cowrote the song “What’s My Name” from The Clash’s 1977 debut album. Please see details as follows 

History 

Please see link for full history and credits of Artist 

Joe Strummer, Mick Jones, Terry Chimes,  Paul Simenon and  Keith Levine became The Clash in late 1976. Inspired by seeing The Sex Pistols and the music they were making, the boys quickly evolved a stance and image that endeared them to the punk masses. Their first outing was a gig at their rehearsal studios in Camden for journalists and friends which caused Giovanni Dadomo a reviewer for Sounds to opine "I think they're the first band to come along who'll really frighten the Sex Pistols shitless."  Indeed their first  public gig was supporting The Sex Pistols at The Screen On The Green Islington London. Charles Shaar Murray, in a famous quote he wishes he'd never made, said in the NME they "..are the kind of garage band who should speedily be returned to their garage, preferably with the motor running." This was too much for Levine who left leaving the boys as a four piece.

Fernandes E series 

1990s 

Grey Burst 

Flamed top

Humbucker 

Hot Rail in Neck

Fernandez Floyd Rose Style Tremolo

Condition - Stage , Tour Used 

Signed verification confirming ownership and use by the artist

The Levene Style 

According to John Frusciante of the Red Hot Chili Peppers, Levene's style was “spectacular , .explored the possibilities of what you can do with the guitar".Upon his death, Massive Attack described Levene as an "artist, architect and re-inventor of punk rock”.

Comments 

The above instrument will be to those players , collectors and investors whom have interest in an instrument that was personally  owned and used by this highly respected Post Punk Guitarist and founding member of both the Clash and PiL.

extended_attributes.description: The TS808 is an incomparable overdrive pedal that's been described as "the Holy Grail of Tubescreamers." The TS808 reissue features the same famous standout square footswitch of the original and the even more famous warm tones of the JRC4558 chip used in most of the original TS808's.Ignore any over-the-counter lookalikes. If your tone is suffering from a lack of real warmth, the TS808 is the real, non-generic prescription. The reissue of the TS808 in '04, and the earlier reissue of the TS9 way back in '93, have meant that players haven't had to plunk down the vast quantities of cash that the originals have been known to fetch.Condition 8/10 Minor Board useALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID All purchases include EU Taxes / Duties paid , ie nothing further is due on receipt of goods to any EU State WHY BUY FROM US We are one of the world's leading specialists in used and vintage gear with over 30 years of experience. extended_attributes.productType: Effects and Pedals / Overdrive and Boost
extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
The TS808 is an incomparable overdrive pedal that's been described as "the Holy Grail of Tubescreamers." The TS808 reissue features the same famous standout square footswitch of the original and the even more famous warm tones of the JRC4558 chip used in most of the original TS808's.

Ignore any over-the-counter lookalikes. If your tone is suffering from a lack of real warmth, the TS808 is the real, non-generic prescription. The reissue of the TS808 in '04, and the earlier reissue of the TS9 way back in '93, have meant that players haven't had to plunk down the vast quantities of cash that the originals have been known to fetch.

Condition 8/10 Minor Board use

extended_attributes.description: CLASSIC BRITISH TONE This is the most celebrated version of the legendary Jennings Musical Industries amplifier, with features based on a 1961/62 design.The combo features the classic design using brown grill cloth, fawn , beige tolex covering (black option also available), leather strap-type handles and two 12” Alnico Blue speakers.The amp’s chassis includes the traditional red JMI control panel, point-to-point wired circuitry, three channels and six inputs (Vib/Trem, Normal, Brilliant), with an option of the classic Top Boost add-on circuit.Control layout: Vib/Trem Speed, Vib/Trem Volume, Normal Volume, Brilliant Volume, Cut (tone), , Bass, Treble Valve configuration: ECC82 (x 1), ECC83 (x 4), EL84 (x 4), GZ34 (x 1)Wattage: 30WSpeaker Options: Blue AlnicoVariable mains voltage selector ( 110 , 240 ) Production - UK Made within the JMI Factory Condition - The amplifier is New although is Show Display Stock so shows light areas of wear to Tolex ( Minimal ) Options - As well as the above we have several other JMI Models available , please email for further details ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID All purchases include EU Taxes / Duties paid , ie nothing further is due on receipt of goods to any EU State WHY BUY FROM US We are one of the world's leading specialists in used and vintage gear with over 30 years of experience. extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
CLASSIC BRITISH TONE


This is the most celebrated version of the legendary Jennings Musical Industries amplifier, with features based on a 1961/62 design.


The combo features the classic design using brown grill cloth, fawn , beige tolex covering (black option also available), leather strap-type handles and two 12” Alnico Blue speakers.


The amp’s chassis includes the traditional red JMI control panel, point-to-point wired circuitry, three channels and six inputs (Vib/Trem, Normal, Brilliant), with an option of the classic Top Boost add-on circuit.


Control layout: Vib/Trem Speed, Vib/Trem Volume, Normal Volume, Brilliant Volume, Cut (tone), , Bass, Treble Valve configuration: ECC82 (x 1), ECC83 (x 4), EL84 (x 4), GZ34 (x 1)


Wattage: 30W


Speaker Options: Blue Alnico


Variable mains voltage selector ( 110 , 240 )

Production - UK Made within the JMI Factory


Condition - The amplifier is New although is Show Display Stock so shows light areas of wear to Tolex ( Minimal )

Options - As well as the above we have several other JMI Models available , please email for further details


ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID 

All purchases include EU Taxes / Duties paid , ie nothing further is due on receipt of goods to any EU State

extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
Classic Tone

We are pleased to offer the following Master Built Tone Bender MK I from the British Pedal Company 

Concept 

The following pedal is one of a small Number of Pedals produced by the BPC master builder which only become  available when 1960s  Original New Old Stock Components are Sourced, i e non standard production 

Tonebender MK I  
Master Built 
Series I Font 
Early 'Flat Gold' Finish 
Original 'Early' Font
Carbon Comp Resistors
Original "60s " Mullard C280 Caps  ( Stripe ) 
Gain Matched Transistors
Specially produced 2x 2G381 + 1x OC75 
Peroid Correct Style Jacks 
Carling Footswitch
Hand Signed  / Dated By Builder 
1 Only of 5 Made

History 

The MKI was most famously used by Jeff Beck and Mick Ronson defining tones throughout several hit songs of the 1960s and 70s. The MKI offers a Thick and aggressive fuzz tone, very different from the Professional MKII which is smoother and more saturated. This limited run will appeal to both collectors and tone enthusiasts who appreciate defining tone in BRITISH FUZZ.

extended_attributes.productType: Amps / Guitar Amps / Guitar Amp Stacks
extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
Classic Amp

We are pleased to offer the following compact Vox Rig

Lil Nightrain Head & Cab

Features/Specifications:

  • Authentic VOX all-tube tone in a stylish and ultra-compact 2-watt head
  • Two 12AX7 preamp vacuum tubes; single 12AU7 power tube
  • Treble & Bass EQ controls; plus Gain and Volume controls
  • Two-way mode switch:
  • Bright boosts the high frequencies and activates the EQ
  • Thick bypasses the EQ and boosts the gain for a full, beefy sound
  • Headphone/line out jack is fantastic for recording Lil? Night Train?s tube sound directly, or for those late night hours of practicing.
  • The Lil? Night Train head and V110NT cabinet are an ideal pair, both sonically and visually

Further Specs:

Lil' Night Train Head:

  • Power Output: 2 Watts RMS into 16 ohm; 1.5 Watts RMS into 8 ohms
  • Controls: Gain, Volume; EQ - Bass, Treble; Mode - Bright, Thick
  • In/Outputs: Guitar Input, Speaker Output(16/8 Ohms), Headphone/Line Output
  • Tube Complement: Pre=2 x 12AX7, Power=1 x 12AU7
  • Dimensions (W x H x D): 222 x 117 x 117 mm/8.74 x 4.61 x 4.61 inches
  • Weight: 2.2Kg/4.85 lbs.

V110NT Speaker Cabinet:


  • Speaker: 10 inch custom Celestion VX 10
  • Dimensions (W x D x H): 420 x 160 x 300mm/16.5 x 6.3 x 11.8 Inches
  • Weight: 5.26 kg/11.6 lbs.
  • Maximum Input: 30 W RMS 16 Ohms

Compact Series Professional MKII Tone Bender

The BPC Compact Series MKII Tone Bender is a detailed replica of the 1966 PROFESSIONAL MK II although in a pedal board friendly casing. The OC81D Loaded Professional MK II can be heard on many Jimmy/Led Zeppelin Tracks such as ‘Whole lotta love’.

extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
THE RIC RAC STUDIOS COLLECTION

We are pleased to offer the following item which was purchased directly from RIC RAC Studios who were responsible for shaping the sound of countless artists including THE SISTERS OF MERCY and Shed Seven , Please see details as follows


The AMS RMX16 was the world's first microprocessor-controlled, full-bandwidth, digital reverberator. Heard on hundreds — if not thousands — of seminal recordings from the 1980s onward, the RMX16 can still be found in nearly every major recording studio all over the world.

The unique and lush reverb programs of the RMX16 are instantly recognizable: 

Ambience
Nonlinear
Room
Hall
Plate reverbs 
Echo

Chorus
Reverse effects

Comments

Exceptionally rare AMS Effect that has has been favoured and used in many of the worlds most famous Studios

extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
*** ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID ***

Compact Dallas Rangemaster

This is a detailed compact replica of one of the worlds most iconic effects. The Dallas Rangemaster treble booster, originally produced in 1965 has been used to by many of the worlds most respected artists including Eric Clapton, Tony Iommi , Rory Gallgher, Brian May, Marc Bolan, Richie Blackmore and many more… although classed as a Treble Booster the Rangemaster was used as an overdrive pedal to give a more distorted but focused tone with many classic British amplifiers that included the legendary Marshall Bluesbreaker and Vox AC30

  • Small Compact Pedal Casing
  • New Gain Selected OC44 Transistor
  • Modern potentiometer
  • Original 1965 Circuit Design
  • Certificate of Authenticity

extended_attributes.description: JEFF LYNNE IDLE RACE AC30 The following amplifier was one of Jeff Lynne’s first guitar amplifiers, purchased in circa 1964 was used in many of Jeff Lynne's early musical collaborations, details as follows: Vox Ac30 1964 ( Circa ) Grey Panel 2+12 Speakers Hand painted to rear “ The Idle Race “ Condition - Used The Idle Race History The Idle Race were a British rock group from Birmingham who in the late 1960s and early 1970s had a cult following and in addition to being the springboard for Jeff Lynne, the band holds a place of significance in British Midlands' pop-rock history as a link between the Move, Electric Light Orchestra, the Steve Gibbons Band and Mike Sheridan & The Nightriders.Link - The Idle RaceJeff Lynne's First Amplifier Please see abstract taken from Beatles “ Fab Four Blog “ that discusses Jeff's First Ever Guitar Amplifier "However The Andicaps didn't last and in 1964 Jeff decided to join another local band called The Chads. it was also in that year that Lynne bought his first electric guitar, a second hand Burns Sonic along with a Vox AC30 amp."Comments The above will be of interest to those players and collectors whom have interest in an amplifier that was at the beginning of the career of one of Britain’s most highly acclaimed musicians, producers and songwriters that being Jeff Lynne.ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAIDAll purchases include EU Taxes / Duties paid , ie nothing further is due on receipt of goods to any EU State.WHY BUY FROM US We are one of the world's leading specialists in used and vintage gear with over 30 years of experience. Prior to shipping each item will be fully serviced and professionally packed SELL - TRADE - CONSIGN If you are looking to sell, trade or consign any of your classic gear please contact us by message.WORLDWIDE COLLECTION - DELIVERY We offer personal delivery and collection services worldwide with offices/locations in London, Amsterdam and Chicago.VALUATION SERVICE If you require a valuation of any of your classic year please forward a brief description and pictures and we will come back to your ASAP.
extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
JEFF LYNNE IDLE RACE AC30 

The following amplifier was one of Jeff Lynne’s first guitar amplifiers, purchased in circa 1964 was used in many of Jeff Lynne's early musical collaborations, details as follows: 

Vox Ac30 

1964 ( Circa ) 

Grey Panel 

2+12 Speakers 

Hand painted to rear “ The Idle Race  “ 

Condition - Used 

The Idle Race History 

The Idle Race were a British rock group from Birmingham who in the late 1960s and early 1970s had a cult following and in addition to being the springboard for Jeff Lynne, the band holds a place of significance in British Midlands' pop-rock history as a link between the Move, Electric Light Orchestra, the Steve Gibbons Band and Mike Sheridan & The Nightriders.

Link - The Idle Race

Jeff Lynne's First Amplifier 

Please see abstract taken from Beatles “ Fab Four Blog “ that discusses Jeff's First Ever Guitar Amplifier 

 

"However The Andicaps didn't last and in 1964 Jeff decided to join another local band called The Chads. it was also in that year that Lynne bought his first electric guitar, a second hand Burns Sonic along with a Vox AC30 amp."

Comments 

The above will be of interest to those players and collectors whom have interest in an amplifier that was at the beginning of the career of one of Britain’s most highly acclaimed musicians, producers and songwriters that being Jeff Lynne.

extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
*** ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID ***

Compact Series MKI Tone Bender

Compact version of the 1965 pedal originally developed by effects wizard Gary Hurst. The MKI Tone Bender became the main tone for artists such as Jeff Beck, Mick Ronson and many more. This pedal was the founding father of British Fuzz.

BPC Compact Series MKI Tone Bender

  • Small casing variant
  • MKI Tone Bender Circuit
  • Handmade in the UK
  • Germanium PNP Transistors
  • Level & Attack Controls
  • Negative 9V DC Power inlet

extended_attributes.description: *** ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID ***BPC MKI.5 Tone Bender.Often known as the mythical fuzz due to the very few original examples which exist, the MKI.5 Tone Bender was produced in 1966 and was the first tone bender that featured the iconic Grey Hammerite Aluminium Casing. The MKI.5 featured a different circuit than the earlier production MK I which consisted of a 2x OC75 transistor circuit At the time of production one of these rare fuzzes managed to find its way into Abbey Road Studios and was pictured being used by George Harrison of The Beatles.BPC MKI.5 Tone Bender. Aluminum cast casing Level and Attack controls 2x OC75 Transistors As used by the Beatles Limited production Certificate of authenticity WHY BUY FROM US? extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
*** ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID ***

BPC MKI.5 Tone Bender.

Often known as the mythical fuzz due to the very few original examples which exist, the MKI.5 Tone Bender  was produced in 1966 and was the first tone bender that featured the iconic Grey Hammerite Aluminium Casing. The  MKI.5 featured a different circuit than the earlier production MK I which consisted of a  2x OC75 transistor circuit  At the time of production one of these rare fuzzes managed to find its way into Abbey Road Studios and was pictured being used by George Harrison of The Beatles.

BPC MKI.5 Tone Bender.

  • Aluminum cast casing
  • Level and Attack controls
  • 2x OC75 Transistors
  • As used by the Beatles
  • Limited production
  • Certificate of authenticity

WHY BUY FROM US? 
We are one of the world's leading specialists in used and vintage gear with over 30 years of experience. Prior to shipping each item will be fully tested and checked so it arrives ready to use and enjoy. If you have any questions we are happy to assist 24/7.

If you are looking to Sell, Trade, Part Exchange or consign any instrument then please contact us through the Denmark Street Online Website and we will come back to you ASAP

extended_attributes.description: We are please to offer the NEW British Pedal Company Lemon Boost Pedal. This pedal was recreated from John Squire's original FET Boost Pedal which was used in the always on position for every Stone Roses gig from 2012 onwards. The pedal uses a specially selected JFET Transistor to re-create the tone of the Tube Tone of a classic AC30 Brilliant input circuit. The pedal offers an overall boost level (Juice) and a 6 position rotary tone selector (Bite) to complement both the input of Humbucker and Single Coil instruments.British Pedal Company Lemon Boost Clean Boost Pedal Specially Selected JFET Transistor Level (Juice) and (Bite) Tone Selector Controls 9v Inlet Small compact casing NB. extended_attributes.productType: Effects and Pedals / Overdrive and Boost
extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
We are please to offer the NEW British Pedal Company Lemon Boost Pedal. This pedal was recreated from John Squire's original FET Boost Pedal which was used in the always on position for every Stone Roses gig from 2012 onwards. The pedal uses a specially selected JFET Transistor to re-create the tone of the Tube Tone of a classic AC30 Brilliant input circuit. The pedal offers an overall boost level (Juice) and a 6 position rotary tone selector (Bite) to complement both the input of Humbucker and Single Coil instruments.

British Pedal Company Lemon Boost

  • Clean Boost Pedal
  • Specially Selected JFET Transistor
  • Level (Juice) and (Bite) Tone Selector Controls
  • 9v Inlet
  • Small compact casing

NB. This pedal in no way officially endorsed by eith John Squire or The Stone Roses

WHY BUY FROM US 

We are one of the world's leading specialists in used and vintage gear with over 30 years of experience. Prior to shipping each item will be fully serviced and professionally packed

extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
*** ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID ***

BPC Compact Series BPC Pepbox

The Compact Series BPC PEPBOX is a scaled down replica of the original unit designed by Pepe Rush for WEM around 1965. This pedal was most famously used by John Lennon at Abbey Road studios during the Revolver Session and can be seen on many photographs from the period. The pedal features 2 Germanium ACY41 Transistors as per the original unit with Effect and Level controls as per the original.

BPC Compact Series PEPBOX

  • 1965 Reissue
  • Compact Casing
  • Hammerite Finish
  • Effect and Level controls
  • ACY41 Transistors
  • As used by John Lennon in Abbey Road

WHY BUY FROM US? 
We are one of the world's leading specialists in used and vintage gear with over 30 years of experience. Prior to shipping each item will be fully tested and checked so it arrives ready to use and enjoy. If you have any questions we are happy to assist 24/7.

*** ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID ***

Celebrating 50 years since its creation, the British Pedal company BPC PEPBOX is a detailed replica of the original unit designed by Pepe Rush for WEM around 1965. This pedal was most famously used by John Lennon at Abbey Road studios during the Revolver Session and can be seen on many photographs from the period. The pedal features 2 Germanium ACY41 Transistors as per the original unit and is housed in a metal enclosure with engraved logo and control panels. The front panel features effect which acts as the gain and then a Level control for the overall volume.

BPC PEPBOX

  • 1965 Reissue
  • MKI PEPBOX Casing
  • Hammerite Finish
  • Engraved front and control panel
  • Jack side and front inputs
  • NOS ACY41 Transistors
  • As used by John Lennon in Abbey Road

extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
*** ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID ***

We are happy to offer a the new Compact Series New Old Stock Dallas Rangemasters. These unlike other standard production Rangmasters that have been offered for general sale have been produced using the original period 1960s New Old Stock Components which include the original 1960s Carbon Comp resistors, Mullard Germanium Transistor and the mythically rare 1960s Welwyn Potentiometers. These key factors add to the overall tone sound and cosmetic appearance and is thus simply as per an original New Old Stock Original. Please find full details as follows:

History
The Dallas Rangemaster was the Treble booster of choice of many iconic artists on 1960s. Produced by John Dallas of London, England these unique units found their way into the hands of players such as Eric Clapton, Brian May, Rory Gallagher, Marc Bolan, Tony Iommi and many more. The Dallas Rangemaster was recently voted in the top 3 of all effects for blues players, offering the iconic tone of the 1960s.

Specification
Compact Series NOS Dallas Rangemaster

New Old Stock
Hammerite finished casing
Original 1960s Mullard Transistor
Original 1960s Welwyn potentionmeter
Carbon Comp Resistors
Hand Produced
Negative 9v input

Sound - Tone
Based on the unit being produced using many of the original components, it is identical in tone/sound to the original 1960s Dallas Rangmaster offering the depth and overall boost that many of the current replica units lack.

Comments
This above unit in tonal terms is identical to an original 1962 Original Dallas Rangemaster that command in excess of £2000 ++++ based on sound, tone and desirability of pedal.

extended_attributes.description: *** ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID ***BPC MKI Wooden Case Prototype Tone BenderThe UK fuzz box phenomenon began in 1965 when electronics engineer Gary Stewart Hurst designed an effects pedal called a Tone Bender. The first production version of the Tone Bender is referred to as the Tone Bender MKI. The MKI featured a three transistor circuit that was based upon the Gibson built Maestro Fuzz-tone. This circuit was modified by Hurst to produce more sustain than its American counter part. The story goes that guitar legend Vic Flick, the man responsible for the James Bond Theme, brought a Fuzz-tone (FZ-1) to Hurst and requested the sustain to be increased. The Tone Bender was one the first ever British made Fuzz box available to the public and sold for 14 guineas. THE BIRTH OF BRITISH FUZZ WAS BORN!CasingThe original “PROTOTYPE” units were housed in a primitive wooden box case and were distributed to session players on the London scene including Jeff Beck. Due to Beck’s heavy use of the pedal he smashed the unit with his heavy foot stomping movements while playing on stage. As word got out about Gary Hurst new design he changed the construction material to steel in order to live up to the rigours of stage use. Comments If Fuzz is your thing then the above will be of interest from both players and collectors a like that creates both the look styling and tone of Britains most famous and iconic of all fuzz effectsBPC MKI Tone Bender 1965 Prototype Reissue Hand Produced Wooden Wedge Shape Case Point to point Wiring (Non Circuit board) 2x 2G381 + 1x OC75 Correct Period Aluminium Knobs Top Input Jack Rear Output Jack Manual On/Off Switch Hand Stained Finish Internally signed and Numbered by Builder Ltd Edition Certificate WHY BUY FROM US? We are one of the world's leading specialists in used and vintage gear with over 30 years of experience. Prior to shipping each item will be fully tested and checked so it arrives ready to use and enjoy. If you have any questions we are happy to assist 24/7. If you are looking to Sell, Trade, Part Exchange or consign any instrument then please contact us through the Denmark Street Online Website and we will come back to you ASAP
extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
*** ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID ***

BPC MKI Wooden Case Prototype Tone Bender

The UK fuzz box phenomenon began in 1965 when electronics engineer Gary Stewart Hurst designed an effects pedal called a Tone Bender. The first production version of the Tone Bender is referred to as the Tone Bender MKI. The MKI featured a three transistor circuit that was based upon the Gibson built Maestro Fuzz-tone. This circuit was modified by Hurst to produce more sustain than its American counter part. The story goes that guitar legend Vic Flick, the man responsible for the James Bond Theme, brought a Fuzz-tone (FZ-1) to Hurst and requested the sustain to be increased. The Tone Bender was one the first ever British made Fuzz box available to the public and sold for 14 guineas. THE BIRTH OF BRITISH FUZZ WAS BORN!

Casing

The original “PROTOTYPE” units were housed in a primitive wooden box case and were distributed to session players on the London scene including Jeff Beck. Due to Beck’s heavy use of the pedal he smashed the unit with his heavy foot stomping movements while playing on stage. As word got out about Gary Hurst new design he changed the construction material to steel in order to live up to the rigours of stage use. Comments If Fuzz is your thing then the above will be of interest from both players and collectors a like that creates both the look styling and tone of Britains most famous and iconic of all fuzz effects

BPC MKI Tone Bender

  • 1965 Prototype Reissue
  • Hand Produced
  • Wooden Wedge Shape Case
  • Point to point Wiring (Non Circuit board)
  • 2x 2G381 + 1x OC75
  • Correct Period Aluminium Knobs
  • Top Input Jack
  • Rear Output Jack
  • Manual On/Off Switch
  • Hand Stained Finish
  • Internally signed and Numbered by Builder 
  • Ltd Edition Certificate

WHY BUY FROM US? We are one of the world's leading specialists in used and vintage gear with over 30 years of experience. Prior to shipping each item will be fully tested and checked so it arrives ready to use and enjoy. If you have any questions we are happy to assist 24/7.

nodes.displayName: 1971 Dan Armstrong Plexi Lucite Guitar Ex Gilby Clarke GUNS 'N' ROSES - Default Title

extended_attributes.description: GILBY CLARKE'S GUNS 'N' ROSES '71 DAN ARMSTRONG LUCITEWe are delighted to feature this 1971 Dan Armstrong Lucite that was played by Gilby Clarke of Guns and Roses from 1992-94, notably at the iconic Freddy Mercury Tribute show at Wembley Stadium 1971 Dan Armstrong Lucite Body Rosewood Neck Condition 8/10 (Stage and Tour Used) Road / Touring Case History The above instrument was stage and tour used by Gilby Clarke of Guns and Roses and can be seen on numerous live and touring performances from 1992 - 1994, including their iconic performance at Freddie Mercury’s Wembley Stadium Tribute Concert and the music video for Use Your Illusion's Garden of EdenVerification The instrument comes with the following: Personally Hand Signed COA From Gilby Clarke Original Stencilled Road / Touring case “Gilby Clarke“ Personal picture Of Gilby prior to saleFrom Vintage Guitar Magazine December 2014...."Talk about the ’71 Dan Armstrong guitar in your collection…""I got that a week before GnR went to England to do a Freddie Mercury tribute show. Once again, I had never played a Dan Armstrong – I just remembered seeing a lot of guys playing them in the ’70s – Mark Bolin, Joe Perry. It was the guitar that, as a young teenager, I saw in the shop and thought, “I want that guitar!” So, I finally bought one, and when I got it, I was struck by how it’s very different from my Les Pauls, very different from my Teles. And strangely enough, it had a lot of gain; it has the pickup modules – Country Bass and Rock Treble. I use Rock Treble, and the guitar doesn’t have a lot of sustain. But, its tone is nice. I was using the Voxes at the time and it sounded great playing those GnR riffs." Comments This guitar was a key ingredient to the sound and look of Gilby Clarke on many live performances with Guns and Roses. Being the guitar which played Paradise City at the Freddie Mercury Tribute Concert in 1992 makes it truly iconic.ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAIDAll purchases include EU Taxes / Duties paid , ie nothing further is due on receipt of goods to any EU State.WHY BUY FROM US We are one of the world's leading specialists in used and vintage gear with over 30 years of experience. Prior to shipping each item will be fully serviced and professionally packed SELL - TRADE - CONSIGN If you are looking to sell, trade or consign any of your classic gear please contact us by message.WORLDWIDE COLLECTION - DELIVERY We offer personal delivery and collection services worldwide with offices/locations in London, Amsterdam and Chicago.VALUATION SERVICE If you require a valuation of any of your classic year please forward a brief description and pictures and we will come back to your ASAP.
extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
GILBY CLARKE'S GUNS 'N' ROSES     '71 DAN ARMSTRONG LUCITE

We are delighted to feature this 1971 Dan Armstrong Lucite that was played by Gilby Clarke of Guns and Roses from 1992-94, notably at the iconic Freddy Mercury Tribute show at Wembley Stadium 

1971 Dan Armstrong 

Lucite Body 

Rosewood Neck 

Condition 8/10 (Stage and Tour Used) 

Road / Touring Case 

History 

The above instrument was stage and tour used by Gilby Clarke of Guns and Roses and can be seen on  numerous live and touring performances from 1992 - 1994, including their iconic performance at Freddie Mercury’s Wembley Stadium Tribute Concert and the music video for Use Your Illusion's Garden of Eden

Verification 

The instrument comes with the following: 

Personally Hand Signed COA From Gilby Clarke 

Original Stencilled Road / Touring case “Gilby Clarke“ 

Personal picture Of Gilby prior to sale

From Vintage Guitar Magazine December 2014....

"Talk about the ’71 Dan Armstrong guitar in your collection…"

"I got that a week before GnR went to England to do a Freddie Mercury tribute show. Once again, I had never played a Dan Armstrong – I just remembered seeing a lot of guys playing them in the ’70s – Mark Bolin, Joe Perry. It was the guitar that, as a young teenager, I saw in the shop and thought, “I want that guitar!” So, I finally bought one, and when I got it, I was struck by how it’s very different from my Les Pauls, very different from my Teles. And strangely enough, it had a lot of gain; it has the pickup modules – Country Bass and Rock Treble. I use Rock Treble, and the guitar doesn’t have a lot of sustain. But, its tone is nice. I was using the Voxes at the time and it sounded great playing those GnR riffs." 

Comments 

This guitar was a key ingredient to the sound and look of Gilby Clarke on many live performances with Guns and Roses. Being the guitar which played Paradise City at the Freddie Mercury Tribute Concert in 1992 makes it truly iconic.

extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
THE RIC RAC STUDIOS COLLECTION

We are pleased to offer the following item which was purchased directly from RIC RAC Studios who were responsible for shaping the sound of countless artists including THE SISTERS OF MERCY and Shed Seven

Please see details as follows

AKAI MX73 Keyboard

The MX73 is a six-octave MIDI controller keyboard designed for flexible use with synths and expanders.

It offers dynamic control with attack velocity but lacks aftertouch functionality.

The keyboard includes four programmable zones, allowing customized range and control per zone, useful for layering and splitting sounds.

Each zone can be assigned an independent MIDI transmit channel (1-16) and program number (0-127).

Master transpose control adjusts the entire keyboard up or down 11 semitones, while individual zones can be transposed up or down three octaves.

Attack velocity for each zone is adjustable on a scale of 1-10, allowing central control over parameters like volume and filter cutoff.

The MX73 includes a master volume slider that sends MIDI volume commands to all channels for simultaneous instrument control.

Assignable controllers include four footswitches, four footpedals, four front-panel sliders, and switches, all independently assignable for each zone.

Programs can store up to 100 parameter setups, accessible via a front-panel keypad or footswitch.

The MX73 includes two MIDI Out ports and a third "External" MIDI Out for independent patch changes, with additional tape in/out jacks for program data storage.

Please note although when removed from the studio the item was functioning, it may require additional service and is sold on an as seen basis

extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
THE RIC RAC STUDIOS COLLECTION


We are pleased to offer the following item which was purchased directly from RIC RAC Studios who were responsible for shaping the sound of countless artists including THE SISTERS OF MERCY and Shed Seven

Please see details as follows

GEMINI X-01 POWER AMP
The X-series amplifiers are a one-time solution for DJs & Club owners. Built strong with a superior cooling & protection technology, they perform with excellence maintaining a quality signal from your mixer to your speakers, with balanced XLR inputs for that extra distance.


FEATURES:
• State-of-the-art bi-polar output stage technology for the finest sound quality and reliability.
• High output power to drive professional loudspeakers without clipping.
• Comprehensive protection circuitry: (Short Circuit, DC, Thermal Cut-off, Sub/Ultrasonic Frequency Filters, Turn-on Delay, Main Fuse, Secondary DC Fuses).
• Three modes of operation: stereo, parallel mono and mono bridge.
• Ground lift switch for flexibility in installations.
• Signal LED & Clip LED for better control.
• Efficient dual aluminum extrusion heatsink design with directly mounted output transistors for no-fault operation.
• Efficient air guide with front-to-rear airflow for thermal stability and reliability.
• Compact 2U well balanced enclosure. 
• Steel reinforced chassis construction for durability and longevity.
• 1/4" TRS & XLR balanced/unbalanced input connectors.

SPECIFICATIONS:
• Output Power EIA: 1kHz @ 1% THD, Wrms
• Both Channels Driven: @ 8 Ohms = 85 Watts, @ 4 Ohms = 110 Watts
• Mono Bridge: @ 8 Ohms = 220 Watts
• Dynamic Headroom: @ 8 Ohms = 1.4 dB, @ 4 Ohms = 1.9 dB
• Frequency Response: 30 Hz - 50 kHz
• Total Harmonic Distortion: Less Than 0.05%, • Typical 0.02% @ 1 kHz
• Signal to Noise Ratio: 100 dB Below Rated • Power @ 8 Ohms
• Damping Factor: Greater Than 200 @ 8 Ohms
• Slew Rate: 20 V/S
• Voltage Gain: 28 dB
• Input Sensitivity (Rated Power @ 8 Ohms): 1 Vrms
• Input Impedance (Unbalanced): 10 kOhms
• Input Impedance (Balanced): 20 kOhms
• Power Consumption (Rated Power @ 4 Ohms, • Both Channels Driven): 400 VA
• AC Power Requirements: 110-120/220-240 • Volts, 60/50 Hz.
• Indicators: 1 Signal LED per Channel, 1 Power LED, 1 Clip LED
• Cooling: Fan, Front-to-Rear Forced Air
• Protection: Short Circuit, DC, Thermal Cut-off, • Sub/Ultrasonic Frequency Filters, Turn-on • Delay, Main Fuse, Secondary DC Fuses
• Balanced/Unbalanced Inputs: XLR & 1/4" 
• Speaker Outputs: 3-Way Binding Posts & 1/4" Jacks

Please note although when removed from the studio the item was functioning, it may require additional service and is sold on an as seen basis

AKAI S2000 Sampler

  • Sampling rate of up to 44.1 kHz
  • 16-bit audio resolution
  • Expandable RAM, typically starting at 2MB, with options for up to 32MB
  • Up to 32 voice polyphony
  • Multiple audio inputs (including stereo) and outputs for flexible routing
  • Full MIDI implementation for integration with other gear
  • Editing features like time stretching, pitch shifting, and various filtering options
  • LCD display with a straightforward navigation system for sample editing and program management
  • Compatible with SCSI drives for sample storage and retrieval
  • Supports various sample formats, including .AKAI files
  • Basic effects processing, such as reverb and delay
  • Options for triggering samples via MIDI and a variety of performance modes
  • Users can create and store multiple programs and banks of samples

The S2000 was designed for both studio and live performance, making it a versatile tool for musicians and producers.

extended_attributes.description: The BPC Silverface pedal is inspired by the early 70's sound. Touch sensitive, gainy, with more of a low mid focus which can be adjusted with the "Depth" control. The circuit has been designed to give natural,valve-like clipping with a smooth,harmonicaly complex sound, synonymous with the dumble signature tone.This pedal shines with humbuckers or singlecoils alike and will flater anything you put through it.BPC Silverface Overdrive Pedal 70s Overdrive voicing Gain, Volume, Tone, Depth controls LED indicator 9V Battery or 9-18V PSU can be used for more headroom ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAIDAll purchases include EU Taxes / Duties paid , ie nothing further is due on receipt of goods to any EU State.WHY BUY FROM US We are one of the world's leading specialists in used and vintage gear with over 30 years of experience. extended_attributes.productType: Effects and Pedals / Overdrive and Boost
extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
The BPC Silverface pedal is inspired by the early 70's sound. Touch sensitive, gainy, with more of a low mid focus which can be adjusted with the "Depth" control. The circuit has been designed to give natural,valve-like clipping with a smooth,harmonicaly complex sound, synonymous with the dumble signature tone.This pedal shines with humbuckers or singlecoils alike and will flater anything you put through it.

BPC Silverface Overdrive Pedal

  • 70s Overdrive voicing
  • Gain, Volume, Tone, Depth controls
  • LED indicator
  • 9V Battery or 9-18V PSU can be used for more headroom

extended_attributes.description: THE RONSON 68 We are happy to offer the following, which has direct links and association with one of Britain’s most respected and influential of all guitarists that being the Spider with the platinum hair himself, Mick Ronson from David Bowie Spiders From Mars. Full details as follows:HistoryThe following instrument was purchased, used in 1970 from the the London music store, Top Gear by British guitarist David Brown of the band, Brave New World. Top Gear was the guitar store of choice within the London scene and was famously frequented by Jimi Hendrix , Jeff Beck, Jimmy Page and Eric Clapton . After Browns purchase he played the instrument at various university and club venues within Northern England and later in circa 1971 - 1972 it was often played and used by his long standing friend and fellow guitarist Mick Ronson who based on his preference, requested the guitar be re-fretted, replacing the original fretless wonder fretsMick Ronson Les PaulMick Ronson's use of Les Paul is synonymous with his sound , tone and look during his time with David Bowie Spiders From Mars.
