extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
THE RONSON 68


We are happy to offer the following, which has direct links and association with one of Britain’s most respected and influential of all guitarists that being the Spider with the platinum hair himself, Mick Ronson from David Bowie Spiders From Mars. Full details as follows:


History


The following instrument was purchased, used in 1970 from the the London music store, Top Gear by British guitarist David Brown of the band, Brave New World. Top Gear was the guitar store of choice within the London scene and was famously frequented by Jimi Hendrix , Jeff Beck, Jimmy Page and Eric Clapton . After Browns purchase he played the instrument at various university and club venues within Northern England and later in circa 1971 - 1972  it was often played and used by his long standing friend and fellow guitarist Mick Ronson who based on his preference, requested the guitar be re-fretted, replacing the original fretless wonder frets



Mick Ronson Les Paul

Mick Ronson's use of Les Paul is synonymous with his sound , tone and look during his time with David Bowie Spiders From Mars. With his most iconic guitar being that of another  original 1968 Black Gibson Les Paul Custom that he later stripped to Natural.


Gibson Les Paul Custom

1968

Serial Number 516826 ( True / Correct For an original 68 )

Black

Maple Cap

Pat Number Pickups

Long Neck Tenon

Waffle Back Machine Heads

Re-Fret (As per Mick Ronson)

Period David Bowie  labelled Band/Road Touring Case


Verification

The above instrument comes with the following verification


Written verification from David Brown who confirms Mick Ronson's use/history and is counter signed by his fellow band member Peter Hudson.


Various original archival pictures of David Brown/Peter Hudson/Brave New World

( Selection Attached )


Original David Bowie labels to road/touring Case


Comments

Original 1968 Les Paul Customs are highly desired by both players and collectors with the above being one of only 100 LP Customs produced in 1968 , this along with the direct connection with Mick Ronson makes this an exceptionally interesting and desired instrument

nodes.title: Default Title
nodes.displayName: British Pedal Company Blackface Overdrive Pedal - Default Title

extended_attributes.description: The BPC Blackface Overdrive pedal takes the sound into the 80's/90's. The circuit feautures a carefully selected op-amp, but is voiced to give a more mid-focused, dynamic and harmonically complex sound, which also has the characteristic bloom of the note and appears to swell as the note sustains. The pedal offers low to mid gain in its normal setting and can be carefully structured using the "Dynamic" control. Increasing this control increases the gain, bite and amount of touch sensitivity. Engaging the gain switch adds more fatness and gain to the sound.BPC Blackface Overdrive Pedal 80s 90s Overdrive voicing Gain, Dynamic, Tone, Volume controls Boost Switch LED indicator 9V Battery or 9-18V PSU can be used for more headroom ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAIDAll purchases include EU Taxes / Duties paid , ie nothing further is due on receipt of goods to any EU State.WHY BUY FROM US We are one of the world's leading specialists in used and vintage gear with over 30 years of experience. extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
The BPC Blackface Overdrive pedal takes the sound into the 80's/90's. The circuit feautures a carefully selected op-amp, but is voiced to give a more mid-focused, dynamic and harmonically complex sound, which also has the characteristic bloom of the note and appears to swell as the note sustains. The pedal offers low to mid gain in its normal setting and can be carefully structured using the "Dynamic" control. Increasing this control increases the gain, bite and amount of touch sensitivity. Engaging the gain switch adds more fatness and gain to the sound.

BPC Blackface Overdrive Pedal

  • 80s 90s Overdrive voicing
  • Gain, Dynamic, Tone, Volume controls
  • Boost Switch
  • LED indicator
  • 9V Battery or 9-18V PSU can be used for more headroom

extended_attributes.descriptionHtml:
Classic Tone

We are pleased to offer the following classic Bass head , details as follows


Ampeg SVT-4 Pro

The Ampeg SVT-4 Pro is a high-powered bass amplifier head designed for professional use, delivering up to 1,600 watts of power at 4 ohms in bridged mono mode.

It features a solid-state preamp and tube-driven MOSFET power section, combining the warmth of tubes with the reliability of solid-state circuitry.

The amp includes a 9-band graphic EQ, along with a 3-band parametric EQ, allowing precise tonal shaping for different playing styles and environments.

The SVT-4 Pro offers flexible tone controls, including Ultra Low, Ultra High, and Bright switches to enhance low-end punch and high-end clarity.

It has a built-in variable compressor to maintain consistent output and control dynamics, ensuring a smooth sound.

The amp provides dual-channel operation (stereo or mono) with independent level controls, allowing versatile use in bi-amp setups or with multiple cabinets.

The SVT-4 Pro includes a balanced line out with pre/post EQ switch and ground lift, making it ideal for direct recording or live sound reinforcement.

It has effects loop functionality with a mix control, offering the ability to blend effects with the dry signal for optimal integration.

Multiple output options include 1/4-inch and Neutrik Speakon jacks, ensuring compatibility with a variety of speaker cabinets.

The rugged design, with a rack-mountable 3U chassis, ensures durability and portability for both studio and live performance environments


Condition 8 /10 - Normal Use / Wear


Note - Classic Ampeg SVT in rack head / format

Details - For further details see quotes

Rockit guitars were made by Rod McKenzie in Everett, Washington from around 2007 onwards. McKenzie had years of experience customizing and building cars and motorcycles and was inspired to make the Rockit electric guitar with a design based on a motorcycle gas tank. McKenzie's friends at the Gompf Brackets company lent their machine shop, tooling and CAD expertise to the project. Although the prototype was made from an actual gas tank the production Rockit guitar bodies were made of fibreglass (much lighter) and could be customised with hot-rod graphics, gold and silver inlays and diamond fret markers. They sold for around $5,000 to $7,000 each.
